He left hashtag#comfort behind… for a hashtag#vision in the desert.A successful hashtag#entrepreneur from hashtag#Europe had it all — stability, a steady business, and a predictable routine.But deep down, he knew he had hit a ceiling.He kept hearing about the hashtag#UAE — where business happens faster, taxes are lower, and growth isn’t limited by borders.So he made the move.What he discovered wasn’t just opportunity — it was hashtag#acceleration.In a matter of months, he expanded his network, accessed global markets, and tapped into resources he never had before.This isn’t a rare story. It’s becoming the norm.More millionaires and billionaires are relocating to the UAE than anywhere else in the world.Why? Username: Hany Elnaggar, CA, M.Sc هاني النجارHany Elnaggar, CA, M.Sc هاني النجار
Post Content:
hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partners’ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnership’s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: •	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: •	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

Hi Folks !!We are urgently hashtaghashtag#Hiring Java Fullstack DeveloperWork Location-Dubai OnsiteExperience level 7+ YearsMust have active passport Nationality-Any Key Responsibilities:We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Java Full Stack Developer to join our development team at Dubai onsite project. The ideal candidate should have strong proficiency in Java back end development as well as hands-on experience with modern front-end technologies. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining scalable web applications end-to-end.Key Responsibilities:Develop and maintain scalable web applications using Java (Spring Boot) on the backend and modern JavaScript frameworks on the frontend (React, Angular, or Vue.js).Collaborate with UI/UX designers, backend engineers, and product managers to implement features and enhance application performance.Design and develop RESTful APIs and integrate third-party services.Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code following best practices.Participate in code reviews, unit testing, and performance tuning.Troubleshoot and debug production issues and implement effective solutions.Stay current with emerging technologies and industry trends to continuously improve development practices.Required Skills & Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.[X+] years of experience as a Full Stack Developer.Strong expertise in Java, Spring Boot, and RESTful API development.Proficiency in front-end technologies such as JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, and frameworks like React.js, Angular, or Vue.js.Experience with relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (e.g., MongoDB).Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git).Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and DevOps tools is a plus.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently or as part of a team.Whose looking for the change or anyone have a reference please share at tahir@mindtelglobal.comhashtag#javafullstack hashtag#angular hashtag#Springboot hashtag#Dubaijob hashtag#immediate

Demand for homes in supertall towers in the Middle East is booming as Gulf nations pursue ambitious mega-projects and global investors flock to secure high-value properties,A lot of people want to have some property here in Dubai, from India, Arab countries … now the Europeans, a lot of them are purchasing here because of the security and good leadership and the [stable] market,Mirwais Azizi, founder and chairman of Azizi Developments, told The National.Dubai’s property market has boomed in recent years on the back of government initiatives such as residency permits for retired and remote workers and the expansion of the 10-year golden visa programme,The overall growth in the UAE’s economy as a result of diversification efforts is also supporting the property market,These individuals are not just seeking residences – they are investing in status symbols, and unique ownership experiences.Azizi Milan is booming soon 💥

𝗧𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗳 𝗦𝗵𝗼𝗰𝗸: 𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗴𝗲 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗵𝘂𝗯𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀!While the region was enjoying a well deserved Eid break, a seismic signal shook global markets — and the aftershocks are only beginning.The U.S. dropped a sweeping tariff announcement & that sent a clear message: 𝗠𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗩𝗨𝗖𝗔 𝗮𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗱What are the second-, third-, even fourth-order effects?No one knows. It’s evolving by the hour.But one thing is clear: 𝗚𝗹𝗼𝗯𝗮𝗹 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗮 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗸𝗲𝘂𝗽Some of these shifts have been brewing since COVID. But this tariff wave might finally push more companies to rethink their long-standing investments in (erstwhile) low-cost, (now possibly) high-risk geographies.𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔, 𝗶𝗻 𝗺𝘆 𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄, 𝗼𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗿 𝗮 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘃𝗮𝗹𝘂𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀• Geopolitical neutrality → insulated from tariff crossfire• Ease of doing business → future-forward regulation, esp. in emerging tech• World-class infrastructure → ports, logistics, and connectivity• Global talent magnet → high ease of living• Aggressive FDI play → targeted programs to attract investment into the region • Strategic location → a true global hubAs the supply chains are redrawn, the region is well-positioned to benefit. The question now is: who moves fast enough to capitalize?𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘀𝗲𝗲𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘆 𝗼𝘂𝘁? 𝗖𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗲𝗰𝗼𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺?(Views are personal)

Post Content:
hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partners’ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnership’s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: •	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: •	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partners’ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnership’s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: •	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: •	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

𝗧𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗳 𝗦𝗵𝗼𝗰𝗸: 𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗴𝗲 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗵𝘂𝗯𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀!While the region was enjoying a well deserved Eid break, a seismic signal shook global markets — and the aftershocks are only beginning.The U.S. dropped a sweeping tariff announcement & that sent a clear message: 𝗠𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗩𝗨𝗖𝗔 𝗮𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗱What are the second-, third-, even fourth-order effects?No one knows. It’s evolving by the hour.But one thing is clear: 𝗚𝗹𝗼𝗯𝗮𝗹 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗮 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗸𝗲𝘂𝗽Some of these shifts have been brewing since COVID. But this tariff wave might finally push more companies to rethink their long-standing investments in (erstwhile) low-cost, (now possibly) high-risk geographies.𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔, 𝗶𝗻 𝗺𝘆 𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄, 𝗼𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗿 𝗮 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘃𝗮𝗹𝘂𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀• Geopolitical neutrality → insulated from tariff crossfire• Ease of doing business → future-forward regulation, esp. in emerging tech• World-class infrastructure → ports, logistics, and connectivity• Global talent magnet → high ease of living• Aggressive FDI play → targeted programs to attract investment into the region • Strategic location → a true global hubAs the supply chains are redrawn, the region is well-positioned to benefit. The question now is: who moves fast enough to capitalize?𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘀𝗲𝗲𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘆 𝗼𝘂𝘁? 𝗖𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗲𝗰𝗼𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺?(Views are personal)

𝗧𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗳 𝗦𝗵𝗼𝗰𝗸: 𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗴𝗲 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗵𝘂𝗯𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀!While the region was enjoying a well deserved Eid break, a seismic signal shook global markets — and the aftershocks are only beginning.The U.S. dropped a sweeping tariff announcement & that sent a clear message: 𝗠𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗩𝗨𝗖𝗔 𝗮𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗱What are the second-, third-, even fourth-order effects?No one knows. It’s evolving by the hour.But one thing is clear: 𝗚𝗹𝗼𝗯𝗮𝗹 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗮 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗸𝗲𝘂𝗽Some of these shifts have been brewing since COVID. But this tariff wave might finally push more companies to rethink their long-standing investments in (erstwhile) low-cost, (now possibly) high-risk geographies.𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔, 𝗶𝗻 𝗺𝘆 𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄, 𝗼𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗿 𝗮 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘃𝗮𝗹𝘂𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀• Geopolitical neutrality → insulated from tariff crossfire• Ease of doing business → future-forward regulation, esp. in emerging tech• World-class infrastructure → ports, logistics, and connectivity• Global talent magnet → high ease of living• Aggressive FDI play → targeted programs to attract investment into the region • Strategic location → a true global hubAs the supply chains are redrawn, the region is well-positioned to benefit. The question now is: who moves fast enough to capitalize?𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘀𝗲𝗲𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘆 𝗼𝘂𝘁? 𝗖𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗲𝗰𝗼𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺?(Views are personal)

Post Content:
hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partners’ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnership’s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: •	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: •	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:• Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.• Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.• Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.• Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFE• Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMH• Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.• Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.• Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

Post Content:
hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partners’ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnership’s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: •	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: •	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

𝗧𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗳 𝗦𝗵𝗼𝗰𝗸: 𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗴𝗲 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗵𝘂𝗯𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀!While the region was enjoying a well deserved Eid break, a seismic signal shook global markets — and the aftershocks are only beginning.The U.S. dropped a sweeping tariff announcement & that sent a clear message: 𝗠𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗩𝗨𝗖𝗔 𝗮𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗱What are the second-, third-, even fourth-order effects?No one knows. It’s evolving by the hour.But one thing is clear: 𝗚𝗹𝗼𝗯𝗮𝗹 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗮 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗸𝗲𝘂𝗽Some of these shifts have been brewing since COVID. But this tariff wave might finally push more companies to rethink their long-standing investments in (erstwhile) low-cost, (now possibly) high-risk geographies.𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔, 𝗶𝗻 𝗺𝘆 𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄, 𝗼𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗿 𝗮 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘃𝗮𝗹𝘂𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀• Geopolitical neutrality → insulated from tariff crossfire• Ease of doing business → future-forward regulation, esp. in emerging tech• World-class infrastructure → ports, logistics, and connectivity• Global talent magnet → high ease of living• Aggressive FDI play → targeted programs to attract investment into the region • Strategic location → a true global hubAs the supply chains are redrawn, the region is well-positioned to benefit. The question now is: who moves fast enough to capitalize?𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘀𝗲𝗲𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘆 𝗼𝘂𝘁? 𝗖𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗲𝗰𝗼𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺?(Views are personal)

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:• Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.• Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.• Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.• Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFE• Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMH• Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.• Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.• Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

Post Content:
hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partners’ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnership’s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: •	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: •	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

𝗧𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗳 𝗦𝗵𝗼𝗰𝗸: 𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗴𝗲 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗵𝘂𝗯𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀!While the region was enjoying a well deserved Eid break, a seismic signal shook global markets — and the aftershocks are only beginning.The U.S. dropped a sweeping tariff announcement & that sent a clear message: 𝗠𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗩𝗨𝗖𝗔 𝗮𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗱What are the second-, third-, even fourth-order effects?No one knows. It’s evolving by the hour.But one thing is clear: 𝗚𝗹𝗼𝗯𝗮𝗹 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗮 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗸𝗲𝘂𝗽Some of these shifts have been brewing since COVID. But this tariff wave might finally push more companies to rethink their long-standing investments in (erstwhile) low-cost, (now possibly) high-risk geographies.𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔, 𝗶𝗻 𝗺𝘆 𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄, 𝗼𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗿 𝗮 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘃𝗮𝗹𝘂𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀• Geopolitical neutrality → insulated from tariff crossfire• Ease of doing business → future-forward regulation, esp. in emerging tech• World-class infrastructure → ports, logistics, and connectivity• Global talent magnet → high ease of living• Aggressive FDI play → targeted programs to attract investment into the region • Strategic location → a true global hubAs the supply chains are redrawn, the region is well-positioned to benefit. The question now is: who moves fast enough to capitalize?𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘀𝗲𝗲𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘆 𝗼𝘂𝘁? 𝗖𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗲𝗰𝗼𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺?(Views are personal)

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:• Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.• Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.• Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.• Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFE• Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMH• Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.• Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.• Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partners’ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnership’s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: •	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: •	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

It’s evolving by the hour.But one thing is clear: 𝗚𝗹𝗼𝗯𝗮𝗹 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗮 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗸𝗲𝘂𝗽Some of these shifts have been brewing since COVID. But this tariff wave might finally push more companies to rethink their long-standing investments in (erstwhile) low-cost, (now possibly) high-risk geographies.𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔, 𝗶𝗻 𝗺𝘆 𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄, 𝗼𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗿 𝗮 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘃𝗮𝗹𝘂𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀• Geopolitical neutrality → insulated from tariff crossfire• Ease of doing business → future-forward regulation, esp. in emerging tech• World-class infrastructure → ports, logistics, and connectivity• Global talent magnet → high ease of living• Aggressive FDI play → targeted programs to attract investment into the region • Strategic location → a true global hubAs the supply chains are redrawn, the region is well-positioned to benefit. The question now is: who moves fast enough to capitalize?𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘀𝗲𝗲𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘆 𝗼𝘂𝘁? 𝗖𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗲𝗰𝗼𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺?(Views are personal)

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:• Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.• Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.• Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.• Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFE• Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMH• Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.• Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.• Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

Post Content:
hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partners’ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnership’s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: •	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: •	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

𝗧𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗳 𝗦𝗵𝗼𝗰𝗸: 𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗴𝗲 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗵𝘂𝗯𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀!While the region was enjoying a well deserved Eid break, a seismic signal shook global markets — and the aftershocks are only beginning.The U.S. dropped a sweeping tariff announcement & that sent a clear message: 𝗠𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗩𝗨𝗖𝗔 𝗮𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗱What are the second-, third-, even fourth-order effects?No one knows. It’s evolving by the hour.But one thing is clear: 𝗚𝗹𝗼𝗯𝗮𝗹 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗮 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗸𝗲𝘂𝗽Some of these shifts have been brewing since COVID. But this tariff wave might finally push more companies to rethink their long-standing investments in (erstwhile) low-cost, (now possibly) high-risk geographies.𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔, 𝗶𝗻 𝗺𝘆 𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄, 𝗼𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗿 𝗮 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘃𝗮𝗹𝘂𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀• Geopolitical neutrality → insulated from tariff crossfire• Ease of doing business → future-forward regulation, esp. in emerging tech• World-class infrastructure → ports, logistics, and connectivity• Global talent magnet → high ease of living• Aggressive FDI play → targeted programs to attract investment into the region • Strategic location → a true global hubAs the supply chains are redrawn, the region is well-positioned to benefit. The question now is: who moves fast enough to capitalize?𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘀𝗲𝗲𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘆 𝗼𝘂𝘁? 𝗖𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗲𝗰𝗼𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺?(Views are personal)

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:• Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.• Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.• Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.• Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFE• Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMH• Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.• Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.• Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

Post Content:
hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partners’ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnership’s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: •	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: •	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants



…more

𝗧𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗳 𝗦𝗵𝗼𝗰𝗸: 𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗴𝗲 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗵𝘂𝗯𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀!While the region was enjoying a well deserved Eid break, a seismic signal shook global markets — and the aftershocks are only beginning.The U.S. dropped a sweeping tariff announcement & that sent a clear message: 𝗠𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗩𝗨𝗖𝗔 𝗮𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗱What are the second-, third-, even fourth-order effects?No one knows. It’s evolving by the hour.But one thing is clear: 𝗚𝗹𝗼𝗯𝗮𝗹 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗮 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗸𝗲𝘂𝗽Some of these shifts have been brewing since COVID. But this tariff wave might finally push more companies to rethink their long-standing investments in (erstwhile) low-cost, (now possibly) high-risk geographies.𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔, 𝗶𝗻 𝗺𝘆 𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄, 𝗼𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗿 𝗮 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘃𝗮𝗹𝘂𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀• Geopolitical neutrality → insulated from tariff crossfire• Ease of doing business → future-forward regulation, esp. in emerging tech• World-class infrastructure → ports, logistics, and connectivity• Global talent magnet → high ease of living• Aggressive FDI play → targeted programs to attract investment into the region • Strategic location → a true global hubAs the supply chains are redrawn, the region is well-positioned to benefit. The question now is: who moves fast enough to capitalize?𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘀𝗲𝗲𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘆 𝗼𝘂𝘁? 𝗖𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗲𝗰𝗼𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺?(Views are personal)

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:• Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.• Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.• Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.• Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFE• Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMH• Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.• Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.• Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partners’ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnership’s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: •	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: •	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

𝗧𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗳 𝗦𝗵𝗼𝗰𝗸: 𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗴𝗲 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗵𝘂𝗯𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀!While the region was enjoying a well deserved Eid break, a seismic signal shook global markets — and the aftershocks are only beginning.The U.S. dropped a sweeping tariff announcement & that sent a clear message: 𝗠𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗩𝗨𝗖𝗔 𝗮𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗱What are the second-, third-, even fourth-order effects?No one knows. It’s evolving by the hour.But one thing is clear: 𝗚𝗹𝗼𝗯𝗮𝗹 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗮 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗸𝗲𝘂𝗽Some of these shifts have been brewing since COVID. But this tariff wave might finally push more companies to rethink their long-standing investments in (erstwhile) low-cost, (now possibly) high-risk geographies.𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔, 𝗶𝗻 𝗺𝘆 𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄, 𝗼𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗿 𝗮 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘃𝗮𝗹𝘂𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀• Geopolitical neutrality → insulated from tariff crossfire• Ease of doing business → future-forward regulation, esp. in emerging tech• World-class infrastructure → ports, logistics, and connectivity• Global talent magnet → high ease of living• Aggressive FDI play → targeted programs to attract investment into the region • Strategic location → a true global hubAs the supply chains are redrawn, the region is well-positioned to benefit. The question now is: who moves fast enough to capitalize?𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘀𝗲𝗲𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘆 𝗼𝘂𝘁? 𝗖𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗲𝗰𝗼𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺?(Views are personal)

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:• Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.• Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.• Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.• Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFE• Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMH• Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.• Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.• Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partners’ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnership’s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: •	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: •	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

𝗧𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗳 𝗦𝗵𝗼𝗰𝗸: 𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗴𝗲 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗵𝘂𝗯𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀!While the region was enjoying a well deserved Eid break, a seismic signal shook global markets — and the aftershocks are only beginning.The U.S. dropped a sweeping tariff announcement & that sent a clear message: 𝗠𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗩𝗨𝗖𝗔 𝗮𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗱What are the second-, third-, even fourth-order effects?No one knows. It’s evolving by the hour.But one thing is clear: 𝗚𝗹𝗼𝗯𝗮𝗹 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗮 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗸𝗲𝘂𝗽Some of these shifts have been brewing since COVID. But this tariff wave might finally push more companies to rethink their long-standing investments in (erstwhile) low-cost, (now possibly) high-risk geographies.𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔, 𝗶𝗻 𝗺𝘆 𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄, 𝗼𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗿 𝗮 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘃𝗮𝗹𝘂𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀• Geopolitical neutrality → insulated from tariff crossfire• Ease of doing business → future-forward regulation, esp. in emerging tech• World-class infrastructure → ports, logistics, and connectivity• Global talent magnet → high ease of living• Aggressive FDI play → targeted programs to attract investment into the region • Strategic location → a true global hubAs the supply chains are redrawn, the region is well-positioned to benefit. The question now is: who moves fast enough to capitalize?𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘀𝗲𝗲𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘆 𝗼𝘂𝘁? 𝗖𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗲𝗰𝗼𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺?(Views are personal)

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:• Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.• Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.• Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.• Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFE• Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMH• Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.• Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.• Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. Post Content:
hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partners’ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnership’s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: •	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: •	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

𝗧𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗳 𝗦𝗵𝗼𝗰𝗸: 𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗴𝗲 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗵𝘂𝗯𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀!While the region was enjoying a well deserved Eid break, a seismic signal shook global markets — and the aftershocks are only beginning.The U.S. dropped a sweeping tariff announcement & that sent a clear message: 𝗠𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗩𝗨𝗖𝗔 𝗮𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗱What are the second-, third-, even fourth-order effects?No one knows. It’s evolving by the hour.But one thing is clear: 𝗚𝗹𝗼𝗯𝗮𝗹 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗮 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗸𝗲𝘂𝗽Some of these shifts have been brewing since COVID. But this tariff wave might finally push more companies to rethink their long-standing investments in (erstwhile) low-cost, (now possibly) high-risk geographies.𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔, 𝗶𝗻 𝗺𝘆 𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄, 𝗼𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗿 𝗮 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘃𝗮𝗹𝘂𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀• Geopolitical neutrality → insulated from tariff crossfire• Ease of doing business → future-forward regulation, esp. in emerging tech• World-class infrastructure → ports, logistics, and connectivity• Global talent magnet → high ease of living• Aggressive FDI play → targeted programs to attract investment into the region • Strategic location → a true global hubAs the supply chains are redrawn, the region is well-positioned to benefit. The question now is: who moves fast enough to capitalize?𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘀𝗲𝗲𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘆 𝗼𝘂𝘁? 𝗖𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗲𝗰𝗼𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺?(Views are personal)

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:• Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.• Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.• Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.• Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFE• Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMH• Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.• Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.• Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partners’ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnership’s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: •	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: •	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

𝗧𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗳 𝗦𝗵𝗼𝗰𝗸: 𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗴𝗲 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗵𝘂𝗯𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀!While the region was enjoying a well deserved Eid break, a seismic signal shook global markets — and the aftershocks are only beginning.The U.S. dropped a sweeping tariff announcement & that sent a clear message: 𝗠𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗩𝗨𝗖𝗔 𝗮𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗱What are the second-, third-, even fourth-order effects?No one knows. It’s evolving by the hour.But one thing is clear: 𝗚𝗹𝗼𝗯𝗮𝗹 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗮 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗸𝗲𝘂𝗽Some of these shifts have been brewing since COVID. But this tariff wave might finally push more companies to rethink their long-standing investments in (erstwhile) low-cost, (now possibly) high-risk geographies.𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔, 𝗶𝗻 𝗺𝘆 𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄, 𝗼𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗿 𝗮 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘃𝗮𝗹𝘂𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀• Geopolitical neutrality → insulated from tariff crossfire• Ease of doing business → future-forward regulation, esp. in emerging tech• World-class infrastructure → ports, logistics, and connectivity• Global talent magnet → high ease of living• Aggressive FDI play → targeted programs to attract investment into the region • Strategic location → a true global hubAs the supply chains are redrawn, the region is well-positioned to benefit. The question now is: who moves fast enough to capitalize?𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘀𝗲𝗲𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘆 𝗼𝘂𝘁? 𝗖𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗲𝗰𝗼𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺?(Views are personal)

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:• Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.• Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.• Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.• Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFE• Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMH• Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.• Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.• Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

Post Content:
hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partners’ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnership’s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: •	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: •	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

𝗧𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗳 𝗦𝗵𝗼𝗰𝗸: 𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗴𝗲 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗵𝘂𝗯𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀!While the region was enjoying a well deserved Eid break, a seismic signal shook global markets — and the aftershocks are only beginning.The U.S. dropped a sweeping tariff announcement & that sent a clear message: 𝗠𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗩𝗨𝗖𝗔 𝗮𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗱What are the second-, third-, even fourth-order effects?No one knows. It’s evolving by the hour.But one thing is clear: 𝗚𝗹𝗼𝗯𝗮𝗹 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗮 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗸𝗲𝘂𝗽Some of these shifts have been brewing since COVID. But this tariff wave might finally push more companies to rethink their long-standing investments in (erstwhile) low-cost, (now possibly) high-risk geographies.𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔, 𝗶𝗻 𝗺𝘆 𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄, 𝗼𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗿 𝗮 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘃𝗮𝗹𝘂𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀• Geopolitical neutrality → insulated from tariff crossfire• Ease of doing business → future-forward regulation, esp. in emerging tech• World-class infrastructure → ports, logistics, and connectivity• Global talent magnet → high ease of living• Aggressive FDI play → targeted programs to attract investment into the region • Strategic location → a true global hubAs the supply chains are redrawn, the region is well-positioned to benefit. The question now is: who moves fast enough to capitalize?𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘀𝗲𝗲𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘆 𝗼𝘂𝘁? 𝗖𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗲𝗰𝗼𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺?(Views are personal)

How long does it take to get a job in Dubai? Here's the answer, with actionable points.The time it takes to secure a job in Dubai can vary significantly depending on various factors such as your qualifications, experience, job market conditions, and networking efforts. On average, it may take anywhere from a few weeks to several months to land a suitable position. To increase your chances of getting hired in Dubai efficiently, follow these actionable points:• Research and target industries: Conduct thorough research on industries that are thriving in Dubai, such as finance, hospitality, technology, and construction. Focus your job search on these sectors to align with the demand.• Tailor your CV and cover letter: Customize your curriculum vitae (CV) and cover letter to showcase relevant skills and experience that match the job requirements. Highlight your accomplishments and emphasize how you can contribute to the prospective employer's success. Get in touch with www.dubai-forever.com for the latest ATS-friendly CV.• Utilize online job portals: Register on popular job portals like Bayt, LinkedIn, and Gulf Talent, as well as local websites www.dubai-jobs.me, that list job openings in Dubai. Regularly update your profile and actively apply for positions that suit your expertise.• Engage in networking: Networking is crucial in Dubai's job market. Attend industry events, job fairs, and professional networking gatherings to connect with potential employers and expand your professional circle. View latest networking events here: https://lnkd.in/ddB8bVFE• Use recruitment agencies: Partner with reputable recruitment agencies specializing in Dubai job placements. They often have inside knowledge of available positions and can connect you with relevant job opportunities. Here's a list of the top 20. https://lnkd.in/dYAJvXMH• Obtain necessary certifications: Some roles in Dubai may require specific certifications or licenses. Invest time in acquiring any necessary qualifications to enhance your employability.• Be persistent and patient: Job searching can be challenging, so remain persistent and patient throughout the process. Be open to considering both full-time and part-time opportunities to gain experience and increase your chances of being noticed by employers.• Prepare for interviews: Practice common interview questions and learn about Dubai's business culture and etiquette. This preparation will boost your confidence during interviews and improve your chances of securing job offers.By proactively following these actionable steps, you can significantly reduce the time it takes to land a job in Dubai and increase your prospects of finding a fulfilling and rewarding career opportunity.Remember that perseverance, adaptability, and a positive attitude are essential qualities that employers value in candidates.

Post Content:
hashtag#mof in hashtag#uae issued new Cabinet Decision No. 34 of 2025 on Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited Partnerships.The purpose of the new Cabinet Decision is to clarify the conditions under which investment funds and limited partnerships can qualify as exempt persons under Article 10 of the UAE Corporate Tax Law (Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022).Conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund 1.	Regulatory Oversight:- Must be regulated by a UAE authority (e.g., Securities and Commodities Authority, Financial Free Zone authority). 2.	Investment Activity:- Primary purpose must be the investment of funds in accordance with a documented investment policy. 3.	Ownership Test:- Interests in the fund must be widely held; must not be used primarily to obtain Corporate Tax advantage.- Specific thresholds and ownership diversification rules apply. 4.	Independence:- The fund must be operated independently from investors. 5.	Management Test:- Managed or advised by a regulated investment manager in the UAE.Conditions for a Qualifying Limited Partnership (QLP) 1.	Legal Form:- Must be a limited partnership established under UAE laws or a recognized free zone. 2.	Activities:- Should only conduct investment business. 3.	Partners’ Structure:- General partner must not be subject to corporate tax on the partnership’s income.- Must meet economic substance requirements. 4.	No Corporate Tax Benefit Main Purpose:- The main purpose of the structure must not be to obtain a corporate tax advantage.Additional Points:Notification Requirement: •	Entities must notify the FTA to benefit from exemption.Revocation: •	FTA may revoke status if conditions are no longer met.hashtag#ftahashtag#uaectDhruva Consultants

𝗧𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗳 𝗦𝗵𝗼𝗰𝗸: 𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗴𝗲 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗵𝘂𝗯𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀!While the region was enjoying a well deserved Eid break, a seismic signal shook global markets — and the aftershocks are only beginning.The U.S. dropped a sweeping tariff announcement & that sent a clear message: 𝗠𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗩𝗨𝗖𝗔 𝗮𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗱What are the second-, third-, even fourth-order effects?No one knows. It’s evolving by the hour.But one thing is clear: 𝗚𝗹𝗼𝗯𝗮𝗹 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗮 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗸𝗲𝘂𝗽Some of these shifts have been brewing since COVID. But this tariff wave might finally push more companies to rethink their long-standing investments in (erstwhile) low-cost, (now possibly) high-risk geographies.𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗔𝗘 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗞𝗦𝗔, 𝗶𝗻 𝗺𝘆 𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄, 𝗼𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗿 𝗮 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘃𝗮𝗹𝘂𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗱𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀• Geopolitical neutrality → insulated from tariff crossfire• Ease of doing business → future-forward regulation, esp. in emerging tech• World-class infrastructure → ports, logistics, and connectivity• Global talent magnet → high ease of living• Aggressive FDI play → targeted programs to attract investment into the region • Strategic location → a true global hubAs the supply chains are redrawn, the region is well-positioned to benefit. The question now is: who moves fast enough to capitalize?𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘀𝗲𝗲𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘆 𝗼𝘂𝘁? 𝗖𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗲𝗰𝗼𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺?(Views are personal)
